thread.title: Sports Roundup: Warriors clinch share of volleyball title
thread.title_full: Sports Roundup: Warriors clinch share of volleyball title

author: Staff
title: Sports Roundup: Warriors clinch share of volleyball title
text:
Sports Roundup: Warriors clinch share of volleyball title Also Hendrix soccer and cross country; UCA soccer   10:22pm LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
The Hendrix College volleyball team secured a least a share of the Southern Athletic Association regular-season title and the right to host the SAA Tournament in two weeks with a 25-9, 25-21, 25-15 sweep of Sewanee-The University of the South on Saturday. 
The win was also the 100th in the career of head coach Ryan Meek, who is in his fifth season at the helm of the Warriors (19-7, 12-1). 
For the match, the Warriors hit .252 with 38 kills, three aces, 56 digs and six blocks. The Tigers hit .067 with 28 kills, two aces, 48 digs and two blocks. 
Sophomore right side hitter Lauren Petrisin hit .385 with 11 kills. Freshman outside hitter Brianna Kelly had seven kills and hit .429. HENDRIX SOCCER 
The Hendrix College women’s soccer team lost to Birmingham-Southern College, 2-1, in the final Southern Athletic Association regular-season game of the season at Warrior Field Saturday. 
With the loss, the Warriors fall to 9-7-1 overall and 2-5 in the league. They will be the sixth seed in the SAA Tournament and will most likely face Rhodes College, the third seed, in Memphis, Tenn. Saturday. The Panthers improve to 8-7 and 3-4 and will be the fifth seed. 
Hendrix drew first blood just 3:44 into the contest when sophomore defender Maddie Mae Seyer scored on a corner kick assist from senior forward Samantha Lallas. BSC tied it up in the 13th mintute on Avery Newcomb’s goal and assist from Sammy Manzo. The Panthers scored the game winner in the 21st minute on a goal by Nicole Newton, assisted by Kayla Auger. 
The Hendrix men won, 3-1, and will likely be the seventh seed in the conference tournament. HENDRIX CROSS COUNTRY 
CLARKSVILLE — For the sixth straight year, the Hendrix College cross country teams claimed the Crystal Trophy at the Arkansas Division III Championship against the University of the Ozarks on Friday. 
The Warrior men topped the Eagles 24-31 and took the top two spots. Junior Cam Meek won the race with a personal best 8K time of 24:19.5. Freshman Nathan Andress was the runner-up in 24:30.6, also a season best. 
Freshmen Sam Byrd and Joshua Beggs also had their best times of the season. Byrd finished fourth in 26:47.3, while Beggs was eighth in 29:31.6. Senior Hunter Briggs rounded out the scoring with a ninth-place finish in 29:40.1. 
Ozarks women edged Hendrix 25-30, but the Warriors claimed second and third place. Freshman Caitlin Camper recorded a personal best time of 21:29.8 on the 5K course to be the runner-up. Junior Dani Ramirez-Aguilar was just behind in 22:06.8. 
Sophomore Joy Spence also had a season best 23:24.6, finishing sixth. Freshman Melissa Pizza placed ninth in 24:01.4 and junior Molly Halter was 10th in 24:42.9. 
The race was the final tune-up before the Southern Athletic Association Championships in Danville, Ky. on Oct. 31. UCA SOCCER 
HAMMOND, La. – Southeastern Louisian (10-4-2, 5-3-1) used a goal by Ana Zadro in the third minute Friday night for a 1-0 victory over the Bears. 
The loss dropped UCA (6-10-1, 3-5-1) into seventh place in the Southland Conference. CBC SOCCER 
The Central Baptist College Mustangs did not let the rain and sloppy conditions spoil Senior Day for defender Nicholas Doyle on Saturday at Centennial Bank Park. The Mustangs scored at will for a 9-0 win today against the short handed Saint Louis College of Pharmacy. 
The Mustangs had eight players scoring with Joe Adkins scoring twice in the rain soaked contest. The lone senior, Nic Doyle scored and also had an assist in the win. 
The Lady Mustangs won their first American Midwest Conference game, 2-1. Tarra Hendricks (assist Allyson Lamb). Lamb scored the other goal.
